page.title: 04Chudleigh Knighton Gazetteer
page.content: The land coverage is mainly rural with woodland both coniferous and deciduous trees,heathland with gorse and bracken. It is famous for the nightingales which nest there. Much of the land is farmland mainly pasture for sheep and cattle. The secondary land cover is residential which covers the whole village. In Chudleigh Knighton we have got private houses,council houses and a residential caravan park. The River Teign flows through the village from Dartmoor. It enters the sea at Teignmouth. The main A38 dual_carriage way skirts the village.This has replaced the old A38 coach road. Ugbrooke House is a historic building home of Lord and Lady Clifford. It is situated amid woodland and parkland to the north of the village.W.B.B. clay works are the main industry.
